page.title: 15Hanchurch Residential School
page.content: Hanchurch Residential School is situated at the edge of Hanchurch village. It is bordered by an expanse of arable land. The ninety year old special school is closing in July 1985. It was opened in 1819 by the Duchess of Sutherland to provide holidays for miners' children. It was adopted by the Local Education Authority in 1919 and has since provided special care and day education for sick and socially disadvantaged children. Thirty six children normally stay in the school for a period of twelve months. For economic reasons it is now planned to incorporate such children either into their local school or another special school. Officials suggest that over the last twenty years the general standard of living has increased and fewer children have special needs. The church hope to reopen it as an independent one
